entry.title: Re: Joule with SFSF ‚Äì Common Setup Issues
entry.content:
Hi,

May I ask if the using the version 1 using OData API works to pick up the groups and replicate them to Workzone standard as well ?

In #9, you mentioned WorkZone groups are supported with SCIM 2.0 and the OData API version is not recommended. 

With OData API as "not recommended", it seems like it is possible to pick up the groups.

Although, we tried also using postman to pick up DynamicGroups with the groupType "deepLinkActivationPermission" [and I'm just mimicking the one in SCIM API], we can't see the relevant groups being retrieved that we see in the Data Inspector TABLE_USERS_GROUP with that groupName/type.

1. Could you confirm if it is not possible with OData and only possible for SCIM API to read the necessary groups from SF ?

2. If possible with Odata, what could we have been missing that is not yet documented here/or in any KBA ?

Thank you

entry.title: Re: Enable Social Login & 2FA for External Candidates in SAP SuccessFactors via SAP Customer Dat
entry.content: Hi @HangTRAN ,  The ideal recommendation would be to use the company account in order to avoid any potential disruptions that may occur with personal accounts. Additionally, some social login providers, such as Facebook, require the account to be verified as being associated with an organization. That said, the final decision is yours, and you may choose based on your company‚Äôs requirements.

entry.title: Business Partner replication to EWM ‚Äì General Role (000000) missing
entry.content:
Question:
We are working on an integration between S/4HANA Public Cloud and decentral EWM. When replicating Business Partners from S/4 to EWM (via SAP_COM_0008), we receive the following error in EWM:

Business Partner role 000000 (General) is missing.

In S/4 Public Cloud:

  • The General Role (000000) is not visible in the Maintain Business Partner app.

  • It cannot be manually assigned to a BP.

  • In the Communication Arrangement (SAP_COM_0008), there is no option to add or force this role.

  • In DRF I only see Monitor Replication, Replicate by Replication Model and Replicate by Object Selection. No customizing available to extend the roles sent.

So far it looks like this cannot be solved from the S/4 side.

Possible solution we identified:
On the EWM side, it should be possible to automatically add the General Role to all incoming BPs. This can be done for example via BAdI /SCWM/EX_BP_INBOUND. According to SAP this is the recommended approach in Cloud integrations, since Public Cloud does not expose the General Role for maintenance.

My questions:

  1. Can you confirm that the General Role (000000) indeed cannot be maintained or forced in S/4 Public Cloud?

  2. Is the approach via EWM (BAdI /SCWM/EX_BP_INBOUND) the correct and supported way to fix this?

  3. Are there any other recommended best practices for handling this issue?

Thanks in advance for your input.

entry.title: Re: Help Needed ‚Äì Error Running ZDMO_CL_FE_TRAVEL_GENERAT...

entry.title: Re: OBN navigation to check user access rights
entry.content:
After much head-scratching (and indeed soul-searching) I discovered that it WAS working - the OBN always returned true when I tested it with my Dev/SDK user, I assume that has some sort of special permission.  But if I use a normal non-dev login, the result returned is based on whether the user has the WCView assigned or not. 

Of all the ways to control the visibility of the EC, this one works really well, and runs quicker / smoother than any alternatives I had come up with (e.g. create temp instance, run action to fetch user UI Switches, change visibility of EC based on that)

entry.title: Re: How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customer
entry.content:
For customers ECC/OP/PCE please see below what we are aware and is informed in the SAP central note since its first releases.

  • Main note. 3196150 - Collective note for Euro changeover in Bulgaria - SAP for Me
  • ERP system 316222 - Local currency changeover to target currency with SAP ERP Systems (ECC) - SAP for Me
  • S/4 PCE/OP 3229024 - S/4HANA Currency Changeover - Central Note - SAP for Me

For PCE/OP customer we have two options

  1. use the LCC tool, but it can be used only with the mandatory participation of SAP (DMLT team) as a paid service and it is run in a pilot mode (not all customers will be invited but only selected few). If the customer would like to explore this option they can contact directly DMLT team as described here 3229024 - Local Currency Change - SAP ONE Support Launchpad.
  2. new company code creation. It is in the hands of the customer and their implementation partner to carry out the project. General information here 3196150 - Collective note for Euro changeover in Bulgaria - SAP ONE Support Launchpad

Additionally, our Globalization Services team also has available collaborative Workzone group for Bulgaria https://pages.community.sap.com/topics/localization/regional-collaboration

Please select the EUR Bulgaria and register. Approvals will be done by Globalization Services and usually soon.

entry.title: Single tenant User-info has been set to null by ProviderTenantNormalizer
entry.content:
Context

  • We forward the end-user token from App A ‚Üí App B using a Destination with Authentication type: OAuth2UserTokenExchange.

  • com.sap.cloud.sdk.services.openapi.core.AbstractOpenApiService need a tenant id for creating apiClient.

Problem (single-tenant)

After deploying to a single-tenant account, the tenant ID appears to be cleared before our handlers run. I traced this to com.sap.cds.services.impl.mt.ProviderTenantNormalizer:

private static class ProviderTenantNormalizer implements UserInfoProvider {

  private final String providerTenant;
  private UserInfoProvider previous;

  public ProviderTenantNormalizer(String providerTenant) {
    this.providerTenant = providerTenant;
  }

  @Override
  public UserInfo get() {
    UserInfo userInfo = previous != null ? previous.get() : null;
    if (userInfo != null && Objects.equals(userInfo.getTenant(), providerTenant)) {
      userInfo = userInfo.copy().setTenant(null);
    }
    return userInfo;
  }

  @Override
  public void setPrevious(UserInfoProvider previous) {
    this.previous = previous;
  }
}

As shown, when the user‚Äôs tenant equals the provider tenant, the tenant is set to null. In a single-tenant scenario, that‚Äôs exactly our case, so the tenant is cleared before any handler is called, and the ApiClient from com.sap.cloud.sdk.services.openapi.core can not be instantiated because it needs a tenant ID.

Question

What is the correct way to configure or consume a user-token forwarding/exchange destination (OAuth2UserTokenExchange) in a single-tenant environment where ProviderTenantNormalizer nulls the tenant?

entry.title: Re: Together with property 'ScheduleLineOrderQuantity' al...
entry.content:
Hello @Rawel 

It's not the POST path that's causing the error, but rather the payload itself. Two key points to note:

Date format ‚Äì use OData V4 ISO-8601 ("2025-10-08T00:00:00Z") instead of "/Date(...)/".

Quantity with unit ‚Äì always send PurchaseOrderQuantityUnit with the schedule line quantity.

Deep insert operates directly through /PurchaseOrder with nested items and schedule lines. The ‚ÄúSchedule Line‚Äù path is unnecessary unless updating an existing PO.

Also check:

PC is valid for the material

remove SupplyingPlant unless it‚Äôs an STO

don‚Äôt send empty custom fields

For more detail check you inbox

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Business Partner replication to EWM ‚Äì General Role (0...
entry.content:
To answer your first question, No, not in Public Cloud. In the Public Edition, the ‚ÄúGeneral‚Äù BP role (000000) is a technical role that exists in the backend but is not exposed in the Maintain Business Partner app, nor in any released API or DRF configuration.

To your second question, yes, you can go with this approach. Implement BAdI /SCWM/EX_BP_INBOUND in decentralized EWM. Check if role 000000 is missing in the inbound payload, in your implementation. If missing, add it before the BP is created/updated in EWM.

Best practice is to keep the S/4 side standard and handle the requirement in EWM, and monitor it.

entry.title: Re: Subtotals on Adobe Forms
entry.content:
Thanks for the blog!

I used the idea with the subtotal flag for my form.
One suggestion from my side:
If you read the subtotal flag not from the subform, you don't even need to add the field to the layout (and to hide it later).

In my case it looks like that:

 var rowCount = this._DATA.count;
 
 for (var i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {  
   var objNameSubtotal = "$record.GT_ANNEX.DATA[" + i + "].SUBTOTAL_LINE";          
   var subtotalNode = xfa.resolveNode(objNameSubtotal);
    
   if (subtotalNode.value == 'X' ) {
     // Do something
   }
}

entry.title: Is it safe to switch from "Standard ABAP" to "ABAP for Cloud Development" if it compiles?
entry.content:
I'd like to prepare the custom code to be compatible with S/4HANA Public Cloud by switching the ABAP Language Version from  "Standard ABAP" to "ABAP for Cloud Development".

With the syntax check, I get partial information about which code needs to be rewritten (replacing BKPF with I_JOURNALENTRY, etc.)

For now, I don't want to run ATC checks for cloud-ready development, I'll do them later.

Without going to S/4HANA Public Cloud yet, if one program needs no modification, is it safe to not test it and keep the ABAP Language Version "ABAP for Cloud Development" in S/4HANA on premises?

Thanks.

Sandra

entry.title: Re: Is it safe to switch from "Standard ABAP" to "ABAP fo...
entry.content:
Without going to S/4HANA Public Cloud yet, if one program needs no modification, is it safe to not test it and keep the ABAP Language Version "ABAP for Cloud Development" in S/4HANA on premises?

No, it's not safe. For instance, you would get the runtime error CALL_METHOD_NOT_PERMITTED raised when calling GET_DDIC_FIELD of CL_ABAP_ELEMDESCR and few other methods (source: Public Cloud Alternative for FM DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET... - SAP Community), even if it runs in S/4HANA on premises (the kernel tests the ABAP Language Version of the class).

entry.title: üá©üá™ Service integration with the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (Munich, DE)
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam introduces attendees to service integration with the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). Specifically, the Node.js flavor of CAP is used.

During this event, you'll become acquainted with how external services can be integrated and consumed from within a CAP project. In working through the exercises you'll also become comfortable with various facilities that CDS offers for declaring, relating and exposing entities, and familiar with how the SAP Cloud SDK covers connectivity and destinations, supporting such integration scenarios with CAP.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Fri 10 Oct 2025 in Munich, DE. It is being kindly hosted at SAP Labs Munich, in Garching. It takes place the day before SAP Inside Track Munich which is also at the same location on Sat 11 Oct.

The instructor is Developer Advocate DJ Adams. 

There are essential prerequisites that must be completed by every attendee, before arriving at the event location. They are documented here: https://github.com/SAP-samples/cap-service-integration-codejam/blob/main/prerequisites.md.

If you wish to attend, please indicate that using the "I'm attending" facility on this page. Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 24 attendees for this event. In that context, if you indicate that you're attending and later realise you can't, please remove your name so that others get a chance instead. Thanks!

For more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.

entry.content:

ÁµêÊûú

ÊúüÂæÖÂãï‰Ωú

  • Â§ñË≤®Âª∫„Å¶„ÅÆÂ†¥Âêà„ÇÇÂÜÜË≤®„Å®ÂêåÊßò„Å´„ÄÅËµ§‰ºùÁ•®„Å®Èªí‰ºùÁ•®„ÅÆÂêàË®à„Åå 0 „Å´„Å™„ÇãÂ†¥Âêà„ÅØ‰∏ÄÊã¨„ÅßÁõ∏ÊÆ∫„Åï„Çå„ÄÅÊîØÊâï„ÅåÂàÜÂâ≤„Åï„Çå„Å™„ÅÑ„Åì„Å®

Ë£úË∂≥

  • ‰ºùÁ•®Êù°‰ª∂ÔºàÊîØÊâïÊñπÊ≥ï„ÄÅÈäÄË°å„Ç≠„Éº„ÄÅÈÄöË≤®„Å™„Å©Ôºâ„ÅØ‰∏ÄËá¥„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Åì„Å®„ÇíÁ¢∫Ë™çÊ∏à„Åø

  • ÂÜÖË≤®ÔºàJPYÔºâ„Åß„ÅØÂïèÈ°å„Å™„Åè 0 ÊîØÊâï„Å®„Åó„Å¶Ê∂à„ÅóËæº„Åæ„Çå„Çã„Åì„Å®„ÇíÁ¢∫Ë™çÊ∏à„Åø

  • Â§ñË≤®„ÅÆ„Åø„Åß POKEN „Éï„É©„Ç∞„ÅåÁ´ã„Å§„Åü„ÇÅ„ÄÅ„Åì„Çå„ÅåÂéüÂõ†„Å®Êé®Ê∏¨„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Åå„ÄÅ„Å™„ÅúÂ§ñË≤®„ÅÆ„Åø„Åì„ÅÆÊåôÂãï„Å®„Å™„Çã„ÅÆ„Åã‰∏çÊòé

Issue Summary

In the Automatic Payment Program (F110), when offsetting a foreign currency vendor invoice (debit/black line item) against a credit memo (credit/red line item) for the same vendor with exactly the same amount, it is expected that the payment proposal will net to zero and no payment will be generated. However, in the payment proposal, the items are split and treated as separate payments.

Detailed Conditions

  • Transaction: F110 (Automatic Payment Program)

  • Currency: SGD (the same behavior occurs with other foreign currencies as well)

  • Document conditions:

    • Invoice (debit/black): 100 SGD

    • Credit memo (credit/red): ‚Äì100 SGD

    • Payment method, house bank, company code, and payment currency are identical between the two documents

  • Behavior in local currency (JPY):

    • In similar cases in JPY, the payment proposal correctly nets the items together, resulting in a zero payment which can be processed without splitting

Actual Result

  • Only in the case of foreign currency, the payment proposal splits the items into separate payments

  • In the proposal log, the flag REGUE-POKEN (item-level payment indicator) is set, causing the items to be treated as individual payments

Expected Behavior

  • Even for foreign currency, when the invoice and the credit memo net to zero, the items should be grouped together in the payment proposal and no payment should be generated

  • The behavior should be consistent with local currency (JPY)

Additional Notes

  • All document conditions (payment method, house bank, currency, etc.) are confirmed to be identical

  • In local currency (JPY), zero payments are handled correctly

  • The POKEN flag is only set in foreign currency cases, which seems to be the root cause, but it is unclear why this happens only for foreign currencies

entry.title: How to Log Client IP Addresses Correctly in SAP CDC Audit Logs
entry.content:
Hi, we are facing an issue where we are expecting the Client app IP address to be logged correctly in the Audit logs. Instead of logging the client IP address, it is currently logging the Content Delivery Network (CDN) (for example: Cloudflare) IP address, which is not desired. Somehow, we are losing the client IP.
Please guide us to resolve this issue, "how to log client mobile App IP correctly in CDC?

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to Log Client IP Addresses Correctly in SAP CDC A...
entry.content:
Why is it not logging client IP in CDC Audit logs?

  • When using a Content Delivery Network (CDN) like Cloudflare, the IP address captured by CDC is the IP address of the CDN server that forwarded the request, not the client's IP address. This is because the request is proxied through the CDN, which masks the client's original IP address.

How can we log client IP correctly in CDC Audit Logs?

  • To log the client's IP address correctly in CDC audit logs, you can include a custom header named "X-Gigya-Client-IP" in your API requests to CDC.
  • Here's an example of how to add this header using our PHP SDK: Auditing User's IP Address from REST Calls.

By including the "X-Gigya-Client-IP" header in API requests, you should be able to log the client's IP address correctly in CDC audit logs. You then see this value available in the audit.search endpoint under "httpReq.Headers".

entry.title: Re: how to take return for damaged SFG and RM material ba...
entry.content: Advanced Returns Management with Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge (SDF) will meet your requirement, in Public Cloud. Of course, in return order, you need to enter manually the damaged part, assign the original order as a reference document. Set the Refund Type to Replacement material. Once you create a return delivery, the respective stock will get posted in QI, depending upon your config. Enter the replacement material in the return order under "Returns" tab, so that, system will trigger SDF document. With this approach, your customer will receive only a replacement material for the damaged one.

entry.title: DP Agent Configuration With BTP Hana Cloud Instance
entry.content:
Hello Folks,

Recently, I faced some challenges while configuring the Data Provisioning (DP) Agent with an SAP HANA Cloud instance. In this blog, I want to highlight some important prerequisites, tips, and configuration steps that helped me resolve the issues. I hope this helps others going through the same process.

Before jumping into the configuration, ensure the following network prechecks are done properly:

1. Inbound IP Allowlist from the DP Agent Server

From your DP Agent host machine, make sure inbound IPs are allowed according to the BTP region where your HANA Cloud instance resides as per this guide BTP subaccount region network IP

Example: In my trial account, I allowed all TCP inbound IPs via the VM‚Äôs security group (see screenshot below).
However, for production environments, it‚Äôs recommended to allow only the specific subnet range based on your BTP subaccount region for better security.

2. IP Allowlist and DP Agent Enabled on HANA Cloud

On the SAP HANA Cloud instance side:

Ensure that IP allowlisting is properly configured to accept connections from your DP Agent server.

Also, enable DP Agent connectivity in the SAP HANA Cloud cockpit.

I‚Äôve attached screenshots showing these settings from my trial setup.

 

After completing these two network-level checks, you can verify connectivity using the telnet command to the HANA Cloud host and port. If that works, you're good to proceed with the agent configuration.

Now In terms of connectivity we are ready for the configuration.

configuration :

Before starting the actual configuration, make sure you have the following users ready.

1. Agent Admin HANA User - Generally DBADMIN User

2. HANA User Name for Agent Messaging - Technical user as per your requirements, refer to SAP help guide for user creation, roles, and privileges.

Users, Roles, and Privileges 

3. Most important

This step is often overlooked and causes issues during JDBC-based connectivity.

Make sure to update the following parameters in your dpagentconfig.ini file:

jdbc.enabled=true
jdbc.encrypt=true

If these are not set correctly, you may encounter JDBC errors while connecting to any BTP service.

These settings are mandatory for encrypted JDBC communication.

Once everything is in place, run the agentcli tool to configure your DP Agent.

Now you are able to register the agent in your SAP HANA Cloud instance

you can also verify the result from hana cloud instance.

If you're planning to set up data replication, I highly recommend checking out this excellent blog by haruki blog

 

I hope this post helps others avoid the common pitfalls I encountered.

Thanks for reading! Feel free to drop comments or questions ‚Äî I‚Äôd be happy to help

entry.title: Re: Attachment issue in Delivery
entry.content: If your upload logic only writes to TOAAT without creating the link entry in SRGBTBREL with the correct object type/key, the GOS service won‚Äôt find it. So, execute transaction SGOS or SE16N on SRGBTBREL for your delivery number. If there‚Äôs no entry, you need to create it when uploading.

entry.title: Re: Sales in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Title:
Revenue Recognition in S/4HANA Public Cloud with Service Materials and Preliminary Billing Document

 

Hello Community,

We are currently implementing S/4HANA Public Cloud (Sales) for a services company. The main process flow is:

  • Sales Contract

  • Sales Order

  • Preliminary Billing Document

  • Final Invoice

Our requirement is that when the Preliminary Billing Document is created, Revenue Recognition should already be triggered ‚Äî we don‚Äôt want to wait until the final invoice.

Key points:

  • All materials are of service type (we don‚Äôt want stock materials).

  • Service entry sheets are not applicable, since they are only available in procurement.

  • The goal is to base Revenue Recognition on the Preliminary Billing Document created from the sales order.

We would like to know from the community:

  1. Has anyone managed to make the Preliminary Billing Document trigger Revenue Accounting Items (RAIs) directly in Public Cloud?

  2. If not, what approaches have you used ?

  3. Any official references, experiences, or best practices would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your support and insights!

@DequanXu @Chuma 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sales SAP Revenue Accounting and Reporting

entry.title: Re: PRICAT in SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Retail
entry.content:
PRICAT are not released for customer use, in Public Edition. Public Cloud uses released APIs and the Retail‚Äëspecific EDI message types are not part of the released scope. If there is a need to exchange price catalogue data in Public Cloud, you must use the released APIs for product and condition replication, or an integration via SAP Integration Suite that transforms to/from PRICAT on the partner side.

For Private Cloud, yes, you can use PRICAT IDocs exactly as in on‚Äëpremise. You can configure ALE/EDI, partner profiles, and process PRICAT inbound/outbound. This is the route if you want to keep existing PRICAT‚Äëbased integrations with minimal change.

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Public Cloud RF Application customization usi...
entry.content:
Hello @PhaniDeepthi_Akula 

Thank you for your question.

Please note that the RF Framework is a standard solution delivered in the Public Cloud. Therefore, it cannot be modified with enhancements like you have in an on-premise solution. The classic RF screens are locked down in public cloud to ensure upgrades are easily installed and compatible.

To achieve your requirement to create a custom button ‚ÄúGR + Label Print‚Äù with navigation to a custom UI flow, the recommended approach in public cloud is:

  • For your inbound processing and label printing, make use of the Fiori Apps that are available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.
  • If the standard apps do not cover the exact scenario, consider building a custom Fiori App via the SAP BTP extension (In-App Extensibility)  and integrate the app into your RF menu. side-by-side extensions on SAP BTP. This will enable your users to select the desired ‚ÄúGR + Label Print‚Äù option ensuring they are redirected to your custom Fiori Flow.

To validate the value entered on the custom screen, the validation logic must be implemented in the custom Fiori app backend service using OData/Rest service which are published in S/4HANA Public Cloud. Please note that your input checks are validated against the Cloud APIs or CDS view.

Consult the following links for more details.

RF Framework

How to use RF scanner in the EWM S/4HANA Cloud system?

side-by-side extensions on SAP BTP.

In-App Extensibility

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Update costing based on the condition value maintaine...
entry.content:
Sorry I am not clear with your requirement. Can you please clarify the following queries

  • Why do you want the unit costing updated at the time of saving a sales contract?
  • Is the costing meant for profitability analysis, reporting, or downstream pricing?
  • Should the costing update happen only at contract save, or also when creating sales orders from the contract?
  • Is the requirement actually to update costing in the sales order (which is derived from the contract) rather than in the contract itself?
  • Is the new condition type a costing condition (condition category ‚ÄòG‚Äô for Freight, or ‚ÄòV‚Äô for Cost)?
  • Is it statistical or relevant for net value?
  • Should it be included in the costing sheet or VPRS calculation?
  • Where exactly should the ‚Äúunit costing‚Äù be updated?

entry.title: Re: Error in BAPI_CONDITION_CONTRACT_CHANGE No data is ch...
entry.content:
It seems, you have not set the change indicator flag correctly. For any field you want to change, you must fill the value in CONDITIONITEMDATAIN, Set the corresponding field in CONDITIONITEMDATAINX to 'X' or the correct change indicator. Also set UPDATEFLAG = 'U' in CONDITIONITEMDATAINX for that condition line. If you don‚Äôt set the X flags, the BAPI ignores the field even if you pass a new value.

From buffering issue point of view, if you check WCOCO immediately after the BAPI in the same LUW/session, you might still see buffered old data. Exit and re‚Äëenter the transaction to confirm.

entry.title: Re: How to show CGST, SGST and IGST separately in Adobe F...
entry.content:
For information, in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the Custom Fields and Logic app is part of the Key User Extensibility toolset. It is delivered by SAP as a standard Fiori app, but whether you can see it depends on your role authorizations.

The app is delivered with the business catalog SAP_CORE_BC_EXT. Your user id must have a business role that includes this catalog. If you don‚Äôt see the app in search, ask your system administrator to assign you a role with this catalog.

entry.title: CREATING CAPM APPLICATION WITH NODE.JS BY USING S/4 HANA DATABASE
entry.content:
Hello All,

In this Blog I would like to share some knowledge on how to Create a basic CAPM application using Sap Business Application Studio and we are going to use the SAP S/4 Hana system to connect and fetch the data.

Lets Divide this Blog into three sections:

1. Prerequisites

2.  Connecting with S/4 HANA Data Base.

3.CRUD Operations

In this Blog lets see what are all the subscriptions and settings to be done to start our application.

Let.. Set.. Go!!

NOTE: May Be This Blog Seems To Be Lengthy, Still Give It A Try U Will Surely Love IT üòÄ

 

 

 

Step1: Lets Subscribe to SAP HANA CLOUD:

Open your SAP BTP trial account and navigate to Service Market Place. Search for S/4 Hana Cloud

 

After Selecting HANA Cloud, you will get the screen like below and Please click on Create.  

 

 

 

Click on Tools and then Create.

 

Once you click on View Subscription , here it shows as below image

 

Note: Remember after subscribing any service you should add security because every service will have its own Role Collections.

Now lets navigate to Users and Click on Default Identity Provider.

 

 

Click on Assign Role Collections, there you can find roles related to Hana cloud( You will find all the roles for the services that are subscribed).

 

 

Select them and click and assign.

 

You can find them under your role collections. Now you have your HANA DB. Lets open it.

 

Step2: Open SAP HANA Cloud and Lets Create Instance.

 

Click on Create Instance and then select HANA Cloud DB.

 

 

 

Here its asking us from which environment our service is going to run, So we need to sign in to Cloud Foundry with your Default Identity Provider Credentials( your email id).Then it returns you this Message.

 

 

 

 

 

Select your space which is default given as dev ( I renamed its as Dev). Instance name can be anything of your choice.

 

 

Enter any password of your choice.

Now leave the next step as it is with storage of 16gb and next please select allow all IP addresses so that it will not block any.

 

 

Click on the three dots over there and there you will find an option to Start. In 10 to 15min your instance would be running.

 

 

Step 3: Setup Work Zone(Fiori Launch Pad):

Search in Market Place > Work Zone

 

Click Create 

 

Please select the Plan as Subscriptions > standard. 

 

Our Subscription would be in progress.

 

 

Note: If this error exists, please subscribe to your Cloud Identity Services.

If you get this, please add trust configuration. So follow the steps below

Initially follow the same process of Subscribing Cloud Identity Provider User Role Collections

Fix: Configure OIDC Trust in SAP BTP

  1. Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit
    Go to your subaccount where you want to subscribe to the application.
  2. Go to Security ‚Üí Trust Configuration
    This is where you manage identity provider (IdP) trust settings.
  3. Add SAP Cloud Identity Services as an OIDC IdP
    • Click Establish Trust.
    • Choose SAP Cloud Identity Services.
    • Select OpenID Connect (not SAML).
    • Enter the required details (Issuer URL, Client ID, etc.) ‚Äî if you have Identity Authentication service (IAS) set up, you can copy these from there.
  4. Set as Default for Business Users

                  ÔÇ∑ Make sure the new OIDC IdP is assigned to business users in your subaccount.

  1. Save & Retry Subscription
    Go back to the subscription page and try again.

Assign the Role collections to users what are all available. Check them all and Click on Assign.

Step 4: CREATE A HANA DB INSTANCE:

Navigate to Service Market Place > Select HANA DB > Create > Under Plan select the Instance.

 

Step 5: Subscribe to Business Application Studio.

Note: By default SAP Business Application Studio would be subscribed. If not subscribe it by yourself.

 

Are you all done!! Lets get into next Episode soon...

References:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/

https://help.sap.com/fiori_bs2013/helpdata/en/a7/1564526ba1f25fe10000000a423f68/content.htm?no_cache...

Hope it‚Äôs helpful üòâ

 

Thanks,
Divya MANDAVA.

entry.title: Re: Encounter error message L9510 when good issue posting...

entry.title: Re: Accelerate the depreciation of one asset
entry.content:
Hello @Dylan2 

Thank you for reaching out to the SAP Community. Your question and the shared screenshot are very helpful

What you have done with transaction type 640 ‚Äì Unplanned Depreciation on prior-year acquisitions is technically correct, but it explains why you don‚Äôt see the 500 CNY as accelerated depreciation under ledger 0L in Manage Fixed Assets.

Why:

Transaction type 640 is used for impairments or extraordinary write-downs. It generates an FI posting and appears in the Transactions / Asset History Sheet view, but it does not modify planned depreciation.

Only the values calculated from the depreciation key and useful life are considered by the depreciation engine. Manual postings made with 640 are not included in the depreciation forecast.

If the goal is to accelerate future depreciation:

Use the Change Asset Master Data app.

Reduce the useful life or alter the depreciation key in the Time-Dependent Data section.

Once the system has recalculated the planned depreciation, you‚Äôll see the changes reflected under ledger 0L in Manage Fixed Assets.

When should you use 640?

Only for true unplanned depreciation events such as impairments, damage, or extraordinary value reductions

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Depreciation Posting Run

Post Depreciation Manually - Unplanned and Planned

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Change Asset Master Data

In brief, the method you used posts correctly, but it doesn‚Äôt speed up planned depreciation. To do that, you need to update the master data (useful life or key) so that the system recalculates depreciation in future runs.

Feel free to reach out again if you still need further support

Thanks again, and kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Regarding the method for calculating the fiscal year...
entry.content:
As rightly pointed out, your requirement is not clear. Please answer the following:

  • Why do you need to display the fiscal year ‚Äî is it for reporting context, filtering, or calculations?
  • Should the fiscal year be based on the current system date only, or on a user‚Äëselected date?
  • Is the fiscal year definition the same for all company codes, or does it vary?
  • Do you already have a fiscal calendar table in the model, or do we need to derive it dynamically?
  • Should the fiscal year be derived from the posting date, document date, or purely the system date?
  • How should the company code influence the fiscal year calculation ‚Äî do different company codes have different fiscal year variants?
  • Do you have a mapping of company code ‚Üí fiscal year variant available in the data model?

entry.title: Re: Data Replication Framework - BusinessPartner Replicat...
entry.content:
Hello @StevenKr 

Thank you for the question.

Note that when you try to replicate BP master data to SAP EWM using the SAP_COM_0008 communication scenario in SAP Public Cloud, the general BP Role is always required. Without it, EWM cannot interpret the Customer or the supplier roles. These depend on the General role as a foundation to that process.

If EWM receives either Customer or Supplier role but not the General role, the replication will fail with the error as it does in your scenario.

I recommend you evaluate the following checks:

  • Confirm that the BP indeed has the 000000-General BP Role assigned.  KBA 3059674 Which is required by EWM to be sent along with the Customer/Supplier roles.
  • Check the replication model setup and ensure the Define Business Partner configuration does not have any role exclusion.
  • You mentioned that your EWM colleague sees only FLCU01/FLVN0, that means the general role was not transmitted or processed. Review the payload sent via the SOAP service using the Message Dashboard to verify the General Role 000000 is included. If this is present and it still does not arrive in EWM, then issue is on the EWM configuration.
  • You should ensure that you create all BPs with General Role. Thereafter re-run replications for all affected BPs.

If after taking those steps the issue still persists then raise an incident under LO-MD-BP which represents the Business Partner and make a reference to SAP_COM_0008 scenario.

Consult the following for more details.

KBA 3245240 Filters for Business Partner (SAP_COM_0008) SOAP Replication Not Taking Effect

KBA 3329385

KBA 3059674

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Which technologies are used to develop travel apps?
entry.content:
Great question! Travel apps require a mix of frontend, backend, mobile frameworks, APIs, and cloud technologies to deliver smooth, scalable, and feature-rich experiences for users. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of the main technologies used to develop travel apps:

1. Frontend Development (User Interface)

This is what users see and interact with:

  • Mobile Frameworks:

    • Swift / Objective-C ‚Üí iOS native apps

    • Java / Kotlin ‚Üí Android native apps

    • Flutter (Dart) ‚Üí Cross-platform (single codebase for iOS & Android)

    • React Native (JavaScript) ‚Üí Cross-platform development

  • UI Libraries & Tools: Material UI (Android), SwiftUI (iOS), Shadcn/UI, Tailwind CSS

2. Backend Development (Server-Side & Logic)

Handles data processing, booking logic, and secure transactions:

  • Programming Languages:

    • Python (Django, Flask, FastAPI)

    • Node.js (Express.js, NestJS)

    • Java (Spring Boot)

    • PHP (Laravel, Symfony)

    • Ruby on Rails

  • Databases:

    • Relational: PostgreSQL, MySQL

    • NoSQL: MongoDB, Firebase Realtime DB

3. APIs & Integrations (Core for Travel Apps)

Travel apps rely heavily on third-party integrations:

  • Flight & Hotel APIs: Amadeus, Skyscanner, Expedia, Booking.com, Sabre, Travelport

  • Maps & Location: Google Maps, Mapbox, OpenStreetMap

  • Weather APIs: OpenWeatherMap, Weatherstack

  • Payment Gateways: Stripe, PayPal, Razorpay, Braintree

  • Chat & Support: Twilio, Sendbird, Firebase Messaging

4. Cloud & Hosting Services

For scalability and performance:

  • AWS (Amazon Web Services) ‚Üí EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda

  • Google Cloud Platform (GCP) ‚Üí Firebase, BigQuery

  • Microsoft Azure ‚Üí App Services, SQL Database

  • Heroku / DigitalOcean for startups & MVPs

5. Security & Compliance

Since travel apps handle payments and personal data:

  • Authentication: OAuth 2.0, JWT, Firebase Auth

  • Encryption: SSL/TLS, AES-256

  • Compliance: GDPR (Europe), PCI DSS (Payments), CCPA (California)

6. AI & Smart Features

For personalization and user experience:

  • Chatbots / Virtual Assistants ‚Üí Dialogflow, IBM Watson, Rasa

  • AI Recommendations ‚Üí TensorFlow, PyTorch, ML Kit

  • Language Translation ‚Üí Google Translate API, Microsoft Translator

7. Other Essential Tools

  • Analytics: Google Analytics, Firebase Analytics, Mixpanel

  • Push Notifications: Firebase Cloud Messaging, OneSignal

  • Testing: Appium, Selenium, XCTest, JUnit

  • CI/CD: GitHub Actions, Jenkins, Bitrise

‚úÖ In short:

  • Native apps ‚Üí Swift (iOS), Kotlin (Android)

  • Cross-platform apps ‚Üí Flutter, React Native

  • Backend ‚Üí Node.js, Python, or Java

  • Cloud ‚Üí AWS, GCP, Azure

  • APIs ‚Üí Travel booking, payment, maps, weather integrations

entry.title: Re: Lumira Bookmark "Error during script processing"

entry.title: TDS provisioning
entry.content:
Hello SAP community,

We are currently facing an issue while executing the end-to-end process for maintaining TDS provisions on service accruals through to final payment

To illustrate the scenario, let's assume that we posted an accrual of ‚Çπ60000 based on the annual services agreed for a particular service. The WHT tax type we're using is 194J @ 10% which is already maintained in the supplier master data. We also ensured to use invoice based WHT tax types/codes in this case.

  1.  Given the above scenario, we issue a SES at year end amounting to ‚Çπ60000
  2.  Now we enter the TDS provision in the app: 'Enter provisions - India' with reference to the purchasing document we created.  JE generated will be: -
    TDS provision A/C..Dr.6000 
    To Withholding tax A/C 6000
  3.  Moving on the next financial year, we post the supplier invoice against the purchasing document that we created earlier.
    GR/IR A/C..Dr60000 
    To Vendor A/C 54000
    To Withholding tax A/C 6000
  4.  Now we utilize the March provision that we posted earlier via the application: 'Utilize provisions-India' 
    Withholding Tax A/C‚Ä¶Dr.6001 
    To TDS provision A/C 6001
  5. We then proceed to reverse the provision that we created via the app: Utilize provision documents - India. 
    TDS provision A/C-6000 
    Withholding Tax A/C‚Ä¶Dr. -6000
  6.  We finally proceed to make the TDS payment in the app: ‚ÄòCreate remittance challan‚Äô, thus completing the process. 

However, we're unable to issue the remittance challan due to the following issue: -

Also, we‚Äôre unsure about the extra ‚Çπ1 showing up in Step 4 ‚Äî how did the amount become ‚Çπ6001 instead of ‚Çπ6000?

Any guidance or clarification regarding these would be greatly appreciated.

  • The discrepancy in the ‚Çπ1 difference

  • The remittance challan issue.

Thank you.

Best regards,

Rishav.

entry.title: Re: Consuming on-Premise Service in CAP Project - Error ‚ÄúFailed to load destination‚Äù after deploymen
entry.content:
Hi @rotem_puterman-sobe ,

Thank you for your response.

I tried, but I‚Äôm still getting the same error. Could you please provide more details on this?

The steps I followed are:

1) The SAP BTP subaccount is connected to the on-premise system using the SAP Cloud Connector.

2) Configured a Destination in BTP with PrincipalPropagation authentication type.

3) Imported the external service into the CAP project using the Service Center in SAP Business Application Studio. This created an external folder with .cds and .js files in the srv directory.

4) Updated package.json to declare the external service, as shown in the attached image.

5) Added Destination and Connectivity service instances in mta.yaml, as shown in the attached image.

Thanks.

entry.title: Re: How to connect from SAP Public cloud(Odata) to SAP ME...
entry.content:
Hello @Sah1 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, you can connect the Public Cloud via OData APIs to an external MES system such as the ones (which can include a third-party solution) you mentioned in your question. However, there are some differences if you compare that to the classic on-prem RFC/JCO connections.

Please note that in SAP Public Cloud, direct RFC calls are not supported. Instead, all integration must go through the public APIs which are available in the SAP API Business Hub.

To answer your question on integration options for MES, make sure you use OData APIs from the S/4HANA cloud. Third Party MES Integration With SAP S4HANA Cloud, SAP Digital Manufacturing Integration Guide Connect your MES systems either through:

  • HTTPs calls to the S/4HANA Cloud OData endpoints or
  • Through SAP CPI as a middleware, which is the recommended approach to handle authentication, mappings and error handling.

Please note that you must create a Communication User + Communication Arrangement for the required OData API. Third Party MES Integration With SAP S4HANA Cloud

To consume MES, configure REST/OData clinets. SAP MII as an example can call OData endpoints directly via HTTP adapter and not through JCO.

Consult the references below for more details.

Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Third Party MES Integration With SAP S4HANA Cloud

Integrating Plant Data from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to SAP Integrated Business Planning

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: WCAG Compliance, patching standard UI5 controls without using extensions
entry.content:
This is a really helpful guide for developers trying to adhere to website accessibility standards in SAP UI5 applications. Addressing accessibility at the code level is often overlooked, so highlighting practical approaches like patching controls without extensions is valuable. Implementing accessibility from the ground up is far more effective than retrofitting later. I also found website accessibility services here: https://mobisoftinfotech.com/services/website-accessibility-services
insightful for businesses looking to maintain WCAG compliance across their digital products.

For developers reading this, what‚Äôs your preferred method for testing accessibility in dynamic UI frameworks?

entry.title: Re: S4 tables for Invoice Lifecycle Report?
entry.content:
The OBJECTID in CDHDR/CDPOS is for the change‚Äëdocument object like BKPF for FI header, RBKP for MM invoice header. So unless the field you‚Äôre looking for is part of that object‚Äôs change‚Äëdoc definition, it won‚Äôt be logged there.

Depending on whether you are using standard S/4HANA AP workflow or OpenText VIM, the relevant tables differ:

Below are the Standard S/4HANA Invoice Workflow

  • SWWWIHEAD ‚Äì Workflow item header (task, work item ID, current agent)
  • SWWUSERWI ‚Äì Work item ‚Üí user assignment
  • SWWLOGHIST ‚Äì Workflow log history (status changes)
  • SWW_CONT / SWW_CONTOB ‚Äì Container elements (process type, document refs)

Similarly, for MM/FI header, you can consider, RBKP which will link to workflow via object key and BKPF.

Now in order to join to your document ID, start from your invoice number in RBKP (for MM) or BKPF (for FI). Get the workflow instance ID from the linkage table (SWWORGTASK or via event linkage in SWEINST). Join to SWWWIHEAD / SWWUSERWI to get the current agent. Join to SWWLOGHIST to get the history rows you see in the Life Cycle report.

entry.title: What is the difference between Password Type and Password Encoding
entry.content: I am working on updating the password encoding then I saw the password type.  Why we need 2 instead of one and how to change password type based on the password encoding.

entry.title: Re: Delete Imported Fixed Assets Master Data
entry.content:
Hi,

Once transaction/document using the FA is booked, the FAMD cannot be removed or turned as Inactive.

The only option is to retire the FA and it would turn it inactive.

Kr,

Jitin
